result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moquis James Brown

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Moquis James Brown in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Moquis James Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter set for Scheduling Conference. Defense informs the court he has not received discovery and offer. For reasons stated on the record, state moves for joinder motion of cases: 2022CF002488, 2021CF004108 and 2020CF001653. Court grants request. State to file motion by 10/28/22.Defense to file response by 11/9/22. Matter set for motion hearing.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 18, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Moquis James Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by video for Moquis James Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Adjustment Number: 22A 090008,
Payable Number: 1033806,
Receipt Number: 22RP038058,
Amount: $20.00
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-13, this case has been reassigned to Judge Franke.

IN PERSON HEARING - ZOOM UNAVAILABLE

Defendant Moquis James Brown in court with Attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for status. Attorney Klimetz has been appointed by SPD. Mr Brown states that he has retained Attorney Mark. Tishberg who is not available for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel
Parties are advised that due to the defendants lower pending matters (20CF1653 & 21CF4108) this matter will be re-assigned to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Moquis James Brown in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant needs to be evaluated to determine his eligibility. Mr Brown is instructed to call the SPD's office to Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Moquis James Brown in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Moquis James Brown in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Moquis James Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that  due to lower pending matters, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Moquis James Brown
Current: 5556 N 68th St. Apt. #215, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: 4963 North 37th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
